intro: Rungia pobeguinii, commonly known as the purple-flowered balsam, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters, with opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers are adapted for pollination by hummingbirds, featuring a deep nectar-filled tube. Rungia pobeguinii is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation in warm climates.
